1.speaker: POLAR BEAR
1.character: 笹子さん 今日の夜　あれやるよ
1.definition: Miss Sasako, we're going to do that tonight.

2.speaker: SASAKO
2.character: えっ！？ あれ　ホントに　やるんですか？
2.definition: Huh? We're actually going to do it? What's "that"?

10.speaker: POLAR BEAR
10.definition: We're going to tell ghost stories {\i1}(kaidan){\i0}.

12.speaker: POLAR BEAR
12.character: これでだいたい揃ったかな

13.speaker: HANDA
13.character: 僕　帰ってもいいですか？
13.definition: Is it okay if I go home?

14.speaker: PANDA
14.character: 怖い話 聞きたいっていうから　連れてきたよ
14.definition: He said he likes scary stories, so I brought him.

15.speaker: HANDA
15.character: 苦手だって言ってるのに…
15.definition: I said I don't like them!

16.speaker: SASAKO
16.character: ロウソクは　これでいいですか？
16.definition: Will this work for the candle?

18.speaker: HANDA
18.character: そんなのいらないですよ！

19.speaker: HANDA
19.character: ほら～　やっぱり　こうなっちゃう
19.definition: I knew it. I knew this would happen.

20.speaker: PENGUIN
20.character: ムードがあって　いいんじゃない？
20.definition: I think it sets the mood.

21.speaker: POLAR BEAR
21.character: しろくまカフェ怪談ナイトにようこそ
21.definition: Welcome to Polar Bear's Café's night of ghost stories.

23.speaker: POLAR BEAR
23.character: 帰り道に おばけが出るかもしれないよ
23.definition: You may see a ghost on your way home. Why would you say something like that?!

24.speaker: HANDA
24.character: わかりましたよ！　いますよ

27.speaker: LLAMA
27.character: これは　僕が実際に体験した
27.definition: This is something I personally experienced

28.speaker: LLAMA
28.character: 動物園のラマコーナーで 起こったことなんですけど
28.definition: at the Llama Corner at the zoo.

29.speaker: LLAMA
29.character: その夜　ラマコーナーには　残業していた 僕しかいなかったんです
29.definition: The only one in the Llama Corner that night was me, who was working overtime.

30.speaker: LLAMA
30.character: 僕が　いつものように 草を食べていると
30.definition: I was eating grass as usual,

31.speaker: LLAMA
31.character: ふと　何かの気配を感じたんです
31.definition: when I felt a faint presence.

33.speaker: LLAMA
33.character: けど　他のラマたちはいるはずがありません
33.definition: But the other llamas shouldn't be there.

34.speaker: LLAMA
34.character: 錯覚だろうと思って 僕はまた草を食べ始めました
34.definition: I thought it must be my imagination, so I started eating the grass again.

35.speaker: LLAMA
35.character: ところが… やっぱり何かの気配を感じます
35.definition: However, I still felt a presence.

36.speaker: LLAMA
36.character: その気配は どんどん近づいてきて

37.speaker: LLAMA
37.character: ついに　僕のすぐ後ろに…
37.definition: and was finally right behind me.

38.speaker: LLAMA
38.character: 僕は　思い切って振り返ったんです

39.speaker: LLAMA
39.character: そこにはいるはずのない
39.definition: and saw something that shouldn't have been there...

41.speaker: LLAMA
41.character: いるはずのない　シマウマの姿は
41.definition: The zebra that shouldn't have been there

42.speaker: LLAMA
42.character: 次の瞬間 跡形もなく消えていました
42.definition: vanished without a trace right after.

43.speaker: LLAMA
43.character: あれ？　怖くなかったですか？

45.speaker: SASAKO
45.character: なんか　シマウマの霊って言われても ピンと　こないっていうか…
45.definition: Well, it's sort of hard to imagine a ghost zebra, I think...

46.speaker: LLAMA
46.character: 僕は話してるだけで ゾッとしますよ
46.definition: Gives me chills just talking about it.

47.speaker: HANDA
47.character: シマウマ…　シマウマ…

48.speaker: PANDA
48.character: 全然　怖くないよ じゃあ

51.speaker: PENGUIN
51.definition: Panda! Wow, you get sleepy when it's dark.

53.speaker: PANDA
53.character: こないだの夜 僕がベッドで寝ようとしたとき…
53.definition: The other night, when I was lying on my bed, trying to sleep...

54.speaker: PANDA
54.character: あれ？　何時頃に寝たんだっけ？
54.definition: Huh? What time did I fall asleep?

55.speaker: PENGUIN
55.character: いいよ　そこは何時でも　続けて

57.speaker: PENGUIN
57.character: 頑張ろうよ　パンダくん

59.speaker: PANDA
59.character: 僕が　ベッドで寝てると
59.definition: As I was sleeping on my bed,

60.speaker: PANDA
60.character: 枕もとで変な音がしたんだよ
60.definition: there was a weird sound by my pillow.

61.speaker: PANDA
61.character: 変な音っていうのは どんな音かな？
61.definition: I wonder what a weird sound sounds like?

62.speaker: PENGUIN
62.character: 僕に聞かれても困るよ

63.speaker: PENGUIN
63.definition: What kind of sound was it?

65.speaker: PENGUIN
65.character: パンダくん　もういいから… キミ　聞いてて
65.definition: That's enough, Panda. Why don't you just listen? Okay!

66.speaker: MANDRILL
66.character: じゃあ　僕が話すよ
66.definition: Then I'll go next! It happened last summer...

68.speaker: MANDRILL
68.character: まだ　何も話してないのに
68.definition: But I haven't said anything yet.

69.speaker: HANDA
69.definition: Your face is scary enough! Then I'll... go...

70.speaker: PENGUIN
70.character: ゾウガメくん　頼むよ　思いっきり　怖いやつ
70.definition: Go for it, Tortoise. Tell us a really scary one. The... animal... loving... Takashi...

71.speaker: PENGUIN
71.character: ペース　上げられないかな？
71.definition: Could you pick up the pace a bit?

73.speaker: TORTOISE
73.character: タカシくんが亡くなりました～

74.speaker: TORTOISE
74.character: お母さんは　毎日　お墓に
74.definition: His mother... would take... the bread crust... that he... liked so much... to his grave... every... day...

75.speaker: PENGUIN
75.character: もう　オチ　いこう　終わらないから
75.definition: Let's jump ahead, otherwise this isn't going to end.

77.speaker: TORTOISE
77.character: ある日　お墓から声が…
77.definition: One day... there was a voice... coming from the grave... Mommy, I'm sick of bread crust {\i0}(pan no mimi){\i1}.

78.speaker: MOM
78.character: じゃあ　何がいいの？

83.speaker: PENGUIN
83.character: 遅いんだな 怖がるタイミングを逃しちゃうよ
83.definition: You're a bit too slow. The timing is too slow to get scared.

84.speaker: HANDA
84.character: み　み…　耳！　耳！！

85.speaker: PENGUIN
85.character: 半田さん　よく怖がれるね
85.definition: You're really good at being scared, Mr. Handa.

86.speaker: PENGUIN
86.character: じゃあ　次は　僕が話すよ

87.speaker: PENGUIN
87.character: あるペンギンが体験した

88.speaker: PENGUIN
88.character: 皆さんの知らない世界の話を お聞かせします
88.definition: a tale of a penguin from a world unknown to you.

89.speaker: PENGUIN
89.character: そのペンギンが　あるパン屋に 出かけたときのことです
89.definition: It happened when this penguin went to a certain bakery.

90.speaker: PENGUIN
90.character: そこには　１人の 看板ペンギンの女の子がいました
90.definition: There was a pretty girl penguin who worked there.

91.speaker: PENGUIN
91.character: 彼女に会うため　ペンギンは 毎日　毎日　パン屋に通いました
91.definition: The penguin went there day after day, just to see her.

93.speaker: PENGUIN
93.character: １人だと思っていた ペンギンの女の子が
93.definition: what he thought was one girl penguin, turned out to be seven!

94.speaker: POLAR BEAR
94.character: それは　怖かっただろうね
94.definition: That must have been really scary.

96.speaker: POLAR BEAR
96.character: けど　そういう 怖いのじゃなくて…
96.definition: But that's the wrong kind of scary.

97.speaker: PENGUIN
97.character: 怖いのは おばけじゃなくて　ペンギンだよ
97.definition: It's not ghosts that are scary, it's penguins.

98.speaker: PANDA
98.character: 大変なんだね　ペンギンさん
98.definition: It must have been hard, Mr. Penguin.

100.speaker: POLAR BEAR
100.character: 実は　僕にもつらくて怖い話があるんだよ
100.definition: It just happens that I have a scary and painful tale, too. What?

103.speaker: POLAR BEAR
103.character: その昔　僕の毛が まだ　黒かった頃のこと
103.definition: Once upon a time, when my hair was still black...

105.speaker: PENGUIN
105.character: なんだろう？　その話…

107.speaker: PENGUIN
107.character: うん　という答えも待たずに 話は続くんでしょ？
107.definition: Yeah, but you're going to continue the story anyways, right? Yep.

108.speaker: POLAR BEAR
108.character: ある日　川で 鮭をたくさんとったあと
108.definition: One day, after catching a lot of salmon at the river,

109.speaker: POLAR BEAR
109.character: お腹がいっぱいになって 昼寝していた　僕の耳もとで何か音がした
109.definition: I had eaten my fill and was taking a nap, when I heard a noise right by my ear.

110.speaker: POLAR BEAR
110.character: なんと　ネズミが 僕の耳をかじっていた
110.definition: It was the sound of a mouse biting my ear.

112.speaker: POLAR BEAR
112.character: こうして　僕の毛は白くなった

113.speaker: POLAR BEAR
113.character: だから僕は今でもネズミが怖い…
113.definition: And to this day, I am scared of mice—

115.speaker: PENGUIN
115.character: 別の意味で怖いよ　その話
115.definition: This story is scary for a completely different reason.

120.speaker: HANDA
120.character: ネ…　ネ…　ネズミ…　ネズミ…

121.speaker: PENGUIN
121.character: 半田さん　いいお客だな
121.definition: You're such a good customer, Mr. Handa.

122.speaker: PENGUIN
122.character: じゃあ　次　笹子さん

123.speaker: SASAKO
123.character: 私　あんまりうまくないんですよ
123.definition: I'm not really good at this.

124.speaker: SASAKO
124.definition: I'm not very fond of scary stories. I-I'm the same way.

125.speaker: HANDA
125.character: あ…　でも　笹子さんの話 聞いてみたいな
125.definition: But I would like to hear your story, Miss Sasako.

126.speaker: SASAKO
126.character: じゃあ　ちょっとだけ
126.definition: All right. Just a short one.

131.speaker: SASAKO
131.character: けど　ここからが怖いんですよ？
131.definition: But I was just getting to the scary part.

132.speaker: PENGUIN
132.character: ごめん…　もういいから
132.definition: I'm sorry, but you can stop now. Mr. Handa!

133.speaker: PANDA
133.character: じゃあね　半田さん

134.speaker: PANDA
134.character: もし　おばけ見たら　電話してね
134.definition: If you see a ghost, give me a call!

136.speaker: HANDA
136.character: やっぱり　今日は 誰かと一緒に帰ろうかな
136.definition: Maybe I should go home with someone tonight.

138.speaker: SASAKO
138.character: 半田さん　１人で帰るの 怖いんじゃないですか？
138.definition: Are you scared to go home by yourself, Mr. Handa? Well...

139.speaker: SASAKO
139.character: でしたら…　私でよかったら 送っていきますよ
139.definition: In that case, if you don't mind, I'll see you home.

140.speaker: HANDA
140.character: あ…　じゃ…　じゃあ…

142.speaker: LLAMA
142.character: 僕　半田さんと 方向　一緒ですから
142.definition: I'm heading in the same direction as Mr. Handa,

143.speaker: LLAMA
143.character: それなら 僕が　送っていきますよ
143.definition: so I can see him home. Um, but...

144.speaker: LLAMA
144.character: 気にしないでください

145.speaker: SASAKO
145.character: それじゃあ ラマさん　半田さん　また
145.definition: Well then, Mr. Llama, Mr. Handa. See you later.

148.speaker: PENGUIN
148.character: ねぇ　これでよかったのかな？
148.definition: Hey. Is this how this should have ended?

149.speaker: POLAR BEAR
149.character: よかったんじゃない？ 怖くなく帰れて
149.definition: I think so. Since he gets to go home without being scared.

150.speaker: LLAMA
150.character: 半田さん　ラクダの霊って 見たことありますか？
150.definition: Mr. Handa, have you ever seen a ghost camel?

152.speaker: LLAMA
152.character: 僕　この前　トイレで見たんですよ
152.definition: I saw one in the bathroom the other day.

154.speaker: GUY
154.definition: Huh? Panda? That's a lot of luggage. Are you running an errand? Please don't ask.

156.speaker: PENGUIN
156.character: それでさ　僕こう言ったわけよ

157.speaker: PENGUIN
157.character: それもしかして座敷童子じゃないの？　って
157.definition: "Maybe it was a house demon." More importantly, how are things with Miss Penko and the others?

158.speaker: PENGUIN
158.character: その件は　ここにいる間だけ 忘れさせてくれない？
158.definition: Could you let me forget about that as long as I'm here?

159.speaker: PENGUIN
159.character: 今は　座敷童子の話だけに 集中したいんだ
159.definition: Right now, I just want to talk about the house demon.

160.speaker: POLAR BEAR
160.definition: Running away from reality? Call it what you want.

162.speaker: POLAR BEAR
162.character: どうしたの？　あの荷物

164.speaker: POLAR BEAR
164.character: 元気ないね　何かあったの？
164.definition: You seem down. Did something happen?

165.speaker: PANDA
165.character: お母さんが　いつも 僕のこと怒るんだ
165.definition: Mom is always getting mad at me.

166.speaker: PANDA MAMA
166.character: また　あなたは 昼間から　ゴロゴロして…
166.definition: There you go, lazing around again.

167.speaker: PANDA
167.character: パンダがゴロゴロして　何が悪いの？
167.definition: What's wrong with a panda lazing around?

168.speaker: PENGUIN
168.character: まぁ　基本　ゴロゴロしてるもんね
168.definition: Well, I guess they are usually lazing around.

169.speaker: PANDA
169.character: 僕から　ゴロゴロを奪ったら なんにも残らないよ？
169.definition: If you take lazing around from me, there won't be anything left.

170.speaker: PENGUIN
170.character: なんにも残らないんだ？
170.definition: So there won't be anything left?

171.speaker: PENGUIN
171.definition: That's amazing in its own right.

172.speaker: PANDA
172.character: お母さんは　きっと 僕が嫌いなんだ

173.speaker: PENGUIN
173.character: え～っと…　お母さんは　もっと　お手伝いして ほしいんじゃないの？
173.definition: Um... Maybe your mom wants you to help out more.

174.speaker: PANDA
174.character: でも　弟や　妹だって ゴロゴロしてるのに
174.definition: But my little brothers and sister laze around, too,

175.speaker: PANDA
175.character: お母さん　怒らないんだよ？
175.definition: and she doesn't get mad at them.

176.speaker: PENGUIN
176.character: それは…　その子たちはまだ小さいからでしょ？
176.definition: Well, it's probably because they're still really young.

177.speaker: PANDA
177.character: 弟や　妹は　かわいいけど 僕は違うからだよ
177.definition: It's because my little brothers and sister are cute, but I'm not.

178.speaker: PENGUIN
178.character: パンダなんて みんな　かわいいじゃない

179.speaker: PANDA
179.definition: This is a picture of my little sister.

181.speaker: POLAR BEAR
181.character: パンダでも違うんだね
181.definition: I guess there is a difference.

184.speaker: PANDA
184.character: やっぱり　僕は 橋の下で拾われた子なんだ
184.definition: So I am a child that was found under the bridge.

185.speaker: PENGUIN
185.character: 橋の下で　パンダ拾えるなら
185.definition: If you could actually find a panda under a bridge,

186.speaker: PENGUIN
186.character: 動物園が　みんな拾いに行くよ
186.definition: then all the zoos would have looked by now.

188.speaker: PANDA
188.character: 実は　家出してきたの
188.definition: Actually, I ran away from home.

189.speaker: POLAR BEAR
189.definition: Oh, I knew it. I see.

190.speaker: PENGUIN
190.character: それで　どこに行くの　橋の下？
190.definition: So, where are you going to go? Under the bridge? What? Couldn't you worry a bit more and invite me to your house or something?

193.speaker: PANDA
193.character: うんとね　ゴロゴロしてても何も言われなくて
193.definition: Let's see, a place where I can laze around without being yelled at,

194.speaker: PANDA
194.character: 黙っててもご飯が出てきて
194.definition: somewhere I'll be fed without having to ask,

195.speaker: PANDA
195.character: パンダくん　かわいいって 言ってくれる
195.definition: and somewhere there's someone to call me cute.

196.speaker: PENGUIN
196.character: それ　かなり限定されてるよね
196.definition: That's limiting things quite a bit, isn't it?

197.speaker: POLAR BEAR
197.character: あ～　リンリンのところは？

198.speaker: PANDA
198.character: イヤだよ　もっと放っておいてほしいんだよ
198.definition: No! I want him to stay even further away.

199.speaker: PENGUIN
199.character: だったら　動物園は？

200.speaker: PENGUIN
200.character: 住み込みでバイトすればいいでしょ
200.definition: You could live there while you work.

201.speaker: KIDS
201.character: うわ～　パンダさん　かわいい！

202.speaker: PANDA
202.character: どうして毎日 働かないといけないの？
202.definition: Why do I have to work every day?

203.speaker: PANDA
203.character: 僕　絶対に 毎日　働くのはイヤなんだよ
203.definition: I don't wanna work every day.

204.speaker: PENGUIN
204.character: そんなに堂々と 言うことじゃないね
204.definition: I don't think that's something you want to say so boldly.

207.speaker: PANDA
207.character: シロクマくん　あの荷物置いといていい？
207.definition: Could I leave my stuff here, Polar Bear?

209.speaker: PANDA
209.character: 家で　晩ご飯食べてくるよ
209.definition: I'm gonna go eat dinner at home.

212.speaker: POLAR BEAR
212.character: いろんな家出があるんだね
212.definition: Apparently there's many forms of running away.

213.speaker: PENGUIN
213.character: こういうのは 家出って言わないでしょ
213.definition: I don't think this is called running away.

214.speaker: PENGUIN
214.character: パンダくん　まだ取りに来てないの家出の荷物
214.definition: Panda still hasn't come by to pick up his luggage from when he ran away?

215.speaker: POLAR BEAR
215.character: うん　昨日 晩ご飯食べに帰ったっきり
215.definition: Yeah, he hasn't been back since he went home for dinner.

218.speaker: PENGUIN
218.character: 家出の仕方間違ってない？
218.definition: Isn't there something wrong with this method of running away?

219.speaker: PANDA
219.character: 家出の続きをしに来ました
219.definition: I came to continue my running away. You know, Panda,

220.speaker: PENGUIN
220.character: お腹が空いたら 家に帰っちゃうんだとさ
220.definition: if you go home when you're hungry,

221.speaker: PENGUIN
221.character: 家出というかさ 何だろう…　日常生活？
221.definition: it's not really running away. How do I put this... It's daily life.

224.speaker: PENGUIN
224.character: いや　戻っていいんだよ

226.speaker: PANDA
226.character: 夕べ　また 大ショックなことがあったんだよ
226.definition: Something really shocking happened again last night.

227.speaker: PANDA MAMA
227.character: 来週は　あなたの お誕生日だけど
227.definition: It's your birthday next week, but I'm a little busy. along with your little siblings.

228.speaker: PENGUIN
228.character: まぁ　大人の都合ってやつだね
228.definition: Well, that makes it easier for your mom.

229.speaker: PENGUIN
229.character: ケーキが１個で済むとかさ
229.definition: I mean, then she'll only have to buy one cake.

230.speaker: PANDA
230.character: ケーキは　何個食べたって いいじゃない
230.definition: But you should be able to have multiple cakes.

231.speaker: PANDA
231.character: お祝いは　何回もあったほうが 楽しいのに
231.definition: The more celebrations there are, the better.

232.speaker: PANDA
232.character: どうして 減らそうとするんだろうね
232.definition: So why would she try to limit them? Jeez, I can't stay there anymore.

234.speaker: SASAKO
234.character: けど　どうしてパンダくんの誕生日じゃなくて
234.definition: In that case, why is she holding his birthday with the younger siblings'

235.speaker: SASAKO
235.character: 弟さんたちの誕生日に合わせるんですかね？
235.definition: instead of holding theirs with his?

237.speaker: POLAR BEAR
237.definition: Isn't she cute? That's not right, Polar Bear.

238.speaker: PENGUIN
238.character: この　かわいい妹さんの写真をかわいくないパンダくんの前で褒めちゃ！
238.definition: You can't compliment the picture of the cute sister, in front of Panda who isn't cute.

240.speaker: PENGUIN
240.character: ま…　待とうよ　パンダくん
240.definition: Hold on a sec, Panda. They are giving you a celebration,

241.character: １か月遅れでも　いいじゃない
241.definition: even though it's a month late. I think you're going to have to compromise.

244.speaker: PANDA
244.character: 僕は　プレゼントに パンダかき氷機が欲しかったんだよ！
244.definition: Because I wanted a panda snow cone maker as a present.

245.speaker: PANDA
245.character: ひと月後だと　もう　かき氷が 食べたくなくなっちゃうよ！
245.definition: In a month, I won't want to eat snow cones anymore!

247.speaker: PANDA
247.character: 僕　もう　ペンギンさんちの子になるよ
247.definition: I'm just going to be your child, Mr. Penguin. Hey! Don't make yourself into my family!

248.speaker: PANDA
248.character: ペンギンさんは　僕のことかわいくないんだ…
248.definition: So you don't think I'm cute, Mr. Penguin.

249.speaker: PENGUIN
249.character: そういう問題じゃないよね？

250.speaker: SASAKO
250.character: いいじゃないですか 置いてあげれば
250.definition: I think it'd be fine if you let him stay with you.

253.speaker: PANDA
253.character: じゃあ　今から　笹子さんちか シロクマくんちの子になるよ
253.definition: Then I'll be a child at Miss Sasako's or Polar Bear's.

254.speaker: BOTH
254.definition: That's not going to happen. So no one wants me as their child.

255.speaker: PANDA
255.character: やっぱり　僕が かわいくないからなんだね…

256.speaker: SASAKO
256.character: そういうことでは ないんだけど…

257.speaker: POLAR BEAR
257.definition: Oh. What if we give you a snow cone maker this month?

258.speaker: POLAR BEAR
258.character: かき氷パーティーしようよ
258.definition: Let's have a snow cone party.

259.speaker: PANDA
259.character: 本当？　いつ？　いつ？

262.speaker: POLAR BEAR
262.character: カフェが休みの日曜で…
262.definition: The Café is closed on Sunday...

263.speaker: POLAR BEAR
263.character: あっ　来週は 町内会の用事があるんだった
263.definition: Oh, there's a meeting with the neighborhood association next week.

264.speaker: PENGUIN
264.character: 僕　再来週は法事でいないよ
264.definition: The week after that, I have a Buddhist memorial service.

265.speaker: SASAKO
265.character: 私も　親戚の結婚式で いないですね
265.definition: I'll be at a relative's wedding that week, too.

266.speaker: POLAR BEAR
266.character: じゃあ…　あっ　来月になっちゃうね
266.definition: Then... Oh, that'll make it next month.

268.character: 土曜の午後なら　どう？

274.speaker: POLAR BEAR
274.character: 荷物　持って帰ったら？
274.definition: Why don't you take your luggage with you?

275.speaker: PANDA
275.character: ああ　それね かき氷パーティーするなら必要だから
275.definition: Oh, we're going to need it if we're having a snow cone party.

276.speaker: PANDA
276.character: かき氷パーティーには これが　なくっちゃね
276.definition: This is essential for snow cone parties.

277.speaker: PENGUIN
277.character: やっぱり　家出の仕方 間違ってるよね？
277.definition: I really do think there's something wrong with your method of running away.

278.speaker: PANDA
278.definition: I can't wait for the weekend!

280.speaker: POLAR BEAR
280.character: かき氷パーティーは中止かな
280.definition: Maybe we'll have to cancel the snow cone party. I think so. Oh.

281.speaker: PENGUIN
281.character: やろう！　今すぐ　やろう！！
281.definition: Let's do it! Let's do it right now!

285.speaker: PANDA
285.character: 雨の日だと　おいしくないね
285.definition: it's not very good on rainy days.

287.speaker: PANDA
287.character: ペンギンさん　ペンギンさん

288.speaker: PENGUIN
288.character: なんだい　パンダ君？

289.speaker: PANDA
289.character: 今日はペンギンさんのご家族に集まって頂いています
289.definition: We had your family gather here today.

290.speaker: PENGUIN
290.character: なんで集めっちゃったの？
290.definition: Why did you have them come?

291.character: なんだか恥ずかしいな

292.speaker: PANDA
292.character: ペンギンさん　さっそく家族会議を始めてよ
292.definition: Mr. Penguin, hurry up and start the family meeting.

293.speaker: PANDA
293.character: 議題はペンギンさんの将来でいい
293.definition: I think the subject should be Mr. Penguin's future.

294.speaker: PENGUIN
294.character: みんなで見てもらうようなもんじゃないな
294.definition: That's not for everyone to watch.

296.speaker: POLAR BEAR
296.character: 来週のしろくまカフェは　二倍速でお送りします
296.definition: Next week's Polar Bear Café will be presented in double speed.

297.speaker: PENGUIN
297.character: できるものならやってみなよ

299.speaker: PENGUIN
299.character: あ、ごめん、やらなくていいよ
299.definition: Sorry, you really didn't have to do it.
